comment: Tasting alone on the rocks.  Very good bourbon.  Smooth and delicious.  Could drink glass after glass.  Highly recommend.
Smells like a meadow or open field.  Taste, wild rye is kicking you in the face.  In a good way.
You smell the cherry upon opening.  However chilled and let it breathe for a bit, and its not bad.   You do taste the cherry still, could be a bit smoother.
Nose is young and ethanol forward with a subtle floral note. Surprisingly balanced for a rye, perfect amount of sweetness balancing a strong brine/olive note.
I taste black tea with a lingering spicy finish.
So unique. Rough straight rye. Spicy and hot
